abstracts.cdata!:
The Sahel Integrated Lowland Ecosystem
            Management Program (SILEM) will provide support for
            environmental and natural resource management related
            activities of the Community-Based Rural Development Project
            (CBRDP). The CBRDP and SILEM are generally expected to cause
            little or no significant adverse impacts in the areas of
            land acquisition and resettlement. Possible areas of impact
            are in loss of land or loss of access to productive and
            other resources. The resettlement policy framework (RPF)
            identifies and sets forth principles and procedures for
            compensation to negatively affected persons. Resettlement
            planning will be mainstreamed into the project design to
            ensure development activities are appropriately screened for
            potential impacts.
